intro: Calanthe longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract calanthe, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact, rhizomatous growth habit and produces elegant, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically blooms with showy, fragrant flowers that are often pink or white in color. Its inflorescence consists of a single spike bearing several flowers, each with three sepals and three petals. Calanthe longibracteata thrives in shady, humid environments and is often found in forest understories.
